definitions: available or situated on a ship, aircraft, or other vehicle

examples.text: the on-board computer controls all critical functions on the ship

shortDefinitions: available or situated on board vehicle

definitions: denoting or controlled from a facility or feature incorporated into the main circuit board of a computer or computerized device
shortDefinitions: controlled from facility incorporated into computer

definitions: go through procedures to effectively integrate (a new employee) into an organization or familiarize (a new customer or client) with one's products or services

examples.text: this data has tremendous value in helping to onboard new hires and manage their performance
my focus has been restructuring how we do things when we onboard a client
